text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

IRM 2.8.6, dated December 08, 2020, is superseded.

This IRM is intended for the general use of IDRS system personnel from all four Business Operating Divisions (W&I, SB/SE, LB&I and TE/GE) and Appeals accessing the Audit Information Management System.
Table of Contents
Command Code AMAXU Command Code AMAXU Command Codes AMAXUE and AMAXUO Command Code AMAXUE/AMAXUO Command Code AMAXU Command Code AMAXU Command Code AMAXUA Command Code AMAXUP
List of terms and deﬁnitions used throughout this IRM Section
Acronym Deﬁnition BMF Business Master File TIF Taxpayer Information File EO Exempt Organizations TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number

Command Code AMAXUP is a correction command code that is used to change or input various ﬁelds to a speciﬁed record on AIMS. This command code is used for records under control of an Employee Plans function. The input document for CC AMAXUP is Form 5598, TE/EP Correction Request.
2.8 Audit Information Management System (AIMS)
) Command Code AMAXUZ (
) For each terminal, there is a

-character “AMAXU Update Counter”, used to keep track of AMAXU updates. The counter is incremented by one for each successful update for AMAXUE, AMAXUA, AMAXUP, AMAXUO. The total number of updates is displayed along with the Request Completed message the following format: “ REQUEST COMPLETED/UPDATES NNNN”. Whenever you wish to reset the counter to zero, enter AMAXUZ in positions
of line and transmit the screen. The message returned will be: “ COUNTER RESET TO
) Command Code AMAXUE, AMAXUA, AMAXUO and AMAXUP (
) Line

of input screen will be reserved for messages. If all data input for CC AMAXUE, AMAXUA, AMAXUO and AMAXUP has been entered successfully and there are no errors encountered, the message “ REQUEST COMPLETED/ UPDATES NNNN” will be displayed on line
If any errors are encountered any of the following error messages may appear on line

Line 24 of input screen will be reserved for messages. If all data input for CC AMAXUE, AMAXUA, AMAXUO and AMAXUP has been entered successfully and there are no errors encountered, the message “ REQUEST COMPLETED/ UPDATES NNNN” will be displayed on line 24. If any errors are encountered any of the following error messages may appear on line 24.

Validation criteria for input ﬁelds
Variable Fields

All item numbers described below represent variable (non-ﬁxed) ﬁelds, which means that there is not a speciﬁc location on the screen where the input item must reside. The input is free-format and the individual item numbers are separated by commas.

Items on the TIF can be changed by the use of CC AMAXU; some items can also be deleted. To delete an item, a “D” should be entered instead of data. Those items which can be deleted are described in Exhibit 2.8.6-5.
The following is a list of the elements that may be changed or deleted by AMAXU Command Code using the following modiﬁers:

Abstracts - Special Processing

Item 404 consist of the Abstract Code, Disposal Code, Abstract Hours, Abstract Results and Abstract Claim Time all refer to one particular Abstract. There may be several of these groups on one record and each group will have a unique Abstract code. The entire Abstract (item 404) has to be present before CC AMAXU can make a change. If a match cannot be made between the Abstract input and a similar Abstract on the AIMS (for the TIN, MFT, Tax Period entered) then the system will assume that the Abstract input is new and it will be added to the record. If a match is made between the Abstract Code input and a similar abstract code on the TIF (for TIN, Tax Period entered) then the systems will change the Disposal Code, Abstract Hours, Abstract Results and Abstract Claim Time following the abstract referenced. If an incorrect Abstract (item 404) was entered it can be deleted by inputting the Abstract in 404 immediately followed by a “D” in item #409.
All items below can be deleted by entering a “D”.
